comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Francis Welch Crowninshield (June 24, 1872 – December 28, 1947), better known as Frank or Crownie (informal), was an American journalist and art and theatre critic best known for developing and editing the magazine Vanity Fair for 21 years, making it a pre-eminent literary journal. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Crowninshield

comment.author: 23103743@N05
63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks for giving us more information B-59. Since he's listed many places as "Frank" we'll add that to the record.
